intro: Oenone glaziovii, commonly known as the Glaziov's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the genus Oenone in the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often hairy. Oenone glaziovii is adapted to grow in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
